name: Linux - System Diagnostics
description: This runbook is intended to provide steps with automations each doing some basic diagnostic steps on the targeted system. Automations provided by this runbook can be used in your own runbook as well.

steps.description:
If you have trouble with your Linux system you can use the following diagnostic steps to figure out potential problems with the configuration of your OS.

First the automation in this step will display the current Memory Usage of the target system: TARGET

Get Current MEM Usage

This output shows you how much total memory is being used and how much is still free.

If the output displays a line with values for "buffer/stale" - then the actual memory which is free equals to the number in that line in column free

This step will present you some Memory Statistics of the specified target system: TARGET

Get VMStats

The wa column in the output displays the time that the CPU spends waiting for I/O operations to complete.

In case this number is much higher than 0 for a longer time then you should have a closer look to the IO usage.
In case the number is always 0 than you can be sure that you are not experiencing any Input/Output related issue.

In this step you monitor Processes, Memory and CPU Usage on the specified target system: TARGET

Get TOP Processes
